requests.name: Motorised Wheelchair

requests.name: Mobility scooter
requests.description: Elderly has just got her feet amputated due to diabetes and she has been feeling helpless with daily functioning. The family has also been under financial distress due to low income. Do contact Marilyn at 81214654 or marilyn@newlifestories.org.sg for further clarifications. Thank you!

requests.name: LIFELINE ABS Safety Handle Support Grab Bar for Toilet Bathroom
requests.description: Client is a breast cancer patient who suffered a relapse in 2024, hence resuming treatment. She is also suffering from neuropathic pain, causing her to be unfit for work. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family of three. He has delayed treatment for his leg to minimise their expenses and continue to provide for his family.

requests.name: Mobility scooter
requests.description: Elderly just underwent surgery to amputate her toes due to diabetes and is unable to walk for prolonged periods of time. She has to provide caregiving to her grandson as her daughter is still residing in a halfway house. The mobility scooter will bring more convenience when she has to fetch her grandson and on days when she needs to buy food or necessities. The support will greatly improve her quality of life. Do contact Marilyn at 81214654 or drop an email to marilyn@newlifestories.org.sg if further clarifications are needed. Thank you!

requests.name: Laptop
requests.description:
Client is a 67 years old senior who lives alone, and was forced to retire as a driver, after he got into an accident 3 years ago. 

Senior is presently not receiving any financial assistance, and gets by with quarterly silver support scheme payouts. 

Senior shared that he always wanted a laptop but could not afford it. He wish to learn how to check emails, as well as to watch his YouTube videos on a bigger screen.

requests.name: Handphone
requests.description: We would like to seek donation for a second-hand phone to a single mother of 4 school-going children as her handphone is faulty. She is currently unemployed and face financial limitations.

requests.name: Laptop
requests.description: 53-year-old lady requires a laptop to conduct job search. Her current laptop is faulty.

requests.name: Laptop
requests.description: Family does not have a working laptop and the client’s wife needs it to prepare a resume to help her with her job search. Client is the sole-breadwinner and his income is not sufficient to support the family, therefore they cannot afford to get their own laptop. As they have 2 young special needs children who are not enrolled in school yet, client and his wife intend to search for materials online to help the children in their education too.

requests.name: Laptop and charger
requests.description: Client’s family of 6 with 4 young children, resides in a 2 room HDB rental flat. As client is taking care of her youngest child who will only enter childcare next year, she is unable to work. Client is also undergoing divorce proceedings and is not receiving any financial support from her husband. As such, client is currently reliant on formal systems for financial assistance . Client intends to look for an administrative job in future and would like to request for a laptop as she is unable to afford it. With the laptop, client will be able to practice her IT skills and apply for jobs online.

requests.name: Crown Gas Stove
requests.description: Member is a single mother caregiving for her 10 year old son and mother who is medically unfit for work. The family relies solely on financial assistance due to her caregiver role and her own mother having diagnosed epilepsy and fits requiring her to stay home to care for her. The family requires a single gas stove with installation for their new rental flat as they were recently made to relocate due to en bloc.

requests.name: Safety shoes
requests.description: Beneficiary is a single man in his early 20s, with no family. He has been surviving on his own since he was in his teens. He is currently homeless and unemployed, mainly due to his mental health issues. He managed to get a job as a warehouse assistant, but is required to purchase his own safety shoes, vest and gloves. He is unable to start work unless he has these items.
